# Title

Smaller title

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
print("this is a new code chunk")
```

```{r}
3+3
```

```{r}
print("Thank you for attending the intro to R session!")
```

# Exercise 3

```{r}
vec1 <- rnorm (100, mean = 10, sd = 2)
```

```{r}
vec1[c(1, 10, 100)]
```

```{r}
mean(vec1)
```

```{r}
sample_mean_100 <- mean(vec1)
difference_100 <- abs(sample_mean_100 - 10)
difference_100
```

```{r}
vec2 <- rnorm (100000, mean = 10, sd = 2)
mean(vec2)
```

```{r}

difference_100000
```

```{r}
diamonds <- ggplot2::diamonds
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = diamonds) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(x = carat), color = "black", fill = "pink") +
  cowplot::theme_cowplot()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = diamonds) +
  geom_point(aes(x = carat, y = price, color = cut)) +
  cowplot::theme_cowplot()
```

# Exercise

```{r}
ggplot(data = diamonds) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(x = price))
```

```{r}
price_by_cut <- diamonds %>% 
  dplyr::filter(carat >1) %>% 
  group_by(cut) %>% 
  summarize(mean_price = mean(price))

price_by_cut %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = cut, y = mean_price, color = cut, fill = cut))
  
```
